elements.name: FilterQ0
elements.title: Which foms do you need to fill out?

elements.name: FilterQ1
elements.title: Which of the following best describes your situation?

choices.text: You are trying to collect on money that is owed to you by the defendent for services you provided, for goods you sold them or for a loan
Dispute over a Contract or agreement

elements.name: FilterProceed
elements.title: Proceed to the next page.

elements.name: ADQ1
elements.title: Are you the Claimant?

elements.name: ADQ1Define1
elements.title: Claimant is the person who started the lawsuit. The name of the claimant will appear at the top of the filed notice of claim.

elements.name: ADQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: ADQ2
elements.title: Have you filed and served on the defendant a Notice of Claim or Notice of Civil Resolution Tribunal Claim?
elements.description: You will have needed to start a claim in either Small Claims Court or the Civil Resolution Tribunal to request a default order.

elements.name: ADQ2Define1
elements.title: Served: Given to the other party the document as set out in the court rules. For example a notice of claim must be personally served on the defendant within one year of filing with the courts.

elements.name: ADQ2Define2
elements.title: Defendant is the person/entity that is being sued.

elements.name: ADQ2End
elements.title: END

elements.name: ADQ3
elements.title: Has the defendant failed to file a reply within the allowed time?
elements.description: The reply is the form the defendant needs to file to respond to your notice of claim or notice of civil resolution tribunal claim.

elements.name: ADQ3Define1
elements.title: Allowed time: The defendant has 14 days to reply to a notice of claim if they are served in British Columbia and 30 days if they are served outside of British Columbia.

elements.name: ADQ4
elements.title: Has the defendant not followed an order to make a deposit?

elements.name: ADQ5
elements.title: What is the full name of the defendant?
elements.description: Write the name exactly as it appears on the notice of claim.

elements.name: ADQ6
elements.title: What is the amount you are claiming from [defendant]?

elements.name: ADQ7
elements.title: Do you have any expenses you are claiming from [defendant]?
elements.description: Certain expenses such as disbursements relating your court case can be claimed such as cost of service. However your legal fees can not be recovered in Small Claims Court.

elements.name: ADQ8
elements.title: What is the amount of expenses claimed?

elements.name: ADQ9
elements.title: Are you claiming interest from [defendant]?
elements.description: If you claimed daily interest from the date of filing your claim you can include the amount that has accumulated since filing. Alternatively if you didn't originally claim interest you can claim the Court set interest rate.claimed on debts. For more information of Court interest rates see:

elements.name: ADQ10
elements.title: What is the amount of interest claimed?

elements.name: ADQ11
elements.title: Are you claiming filing fees?

elements.name: ADQ12
elements.title: What is the amount of filing fees claimed?

elements.name: ADQ13
elements.title: Are you asking the court to make any other order?
elements.description: This is for anything other than the amounts you have described in this application. For example if you are asking for an order that your personal property be returned to you by the defendant.

elements.name: ADQ14
elements.title: Please explain:

elements.name: ADComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: AJQ1
elements.title: Who are you?

elements.name: AJQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: AJQ4
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: AJQ4Q
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: AJQ7
elements.title: Describe the order you are asking the registrar to make.
elements.description: Briefly state the order you want the court to make. Do not state the reasons for this order here.

elements.name: AJQ8
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order.
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order. For example if you are asking for an order permitting a late reply to be filed you will want to include the reasons why you were unable to file a reply on time.

elements.name: AJComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: ARQ1
elements.title: Who are you?

elements.name: ARQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: ARQ4
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: ARQ4Q1
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: ARQ6
elements.title: Please check the order you are asking the court for

choices.text: postponing a settlement conference or trial conference
extending the time for fiming a certificate of readiness
extending the time for fiming a certificate of compliance
exempting the applicant from paying fees
permitting a hearing to be conducted by telephone
permitting service of a claim outside BC

elements.name: ARQ8A
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Renewing a claim]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8B
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Renewing a third party notice]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8C
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Postponing a settlement conference or trial conference]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8D
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Extending the time for fiming a certificate of readiness]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8E
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Extending the time for fiming a certificate of compliance]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8F
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Exempting the applicant from paying fees]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8G
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Permitting a hearing to be conducted by telephone]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8H
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Permitting service of a claim outside BC]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ8I
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Permitting another method of service]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARQ7
elements.title: Describe the order you are asking the registrar to make [Other]
elements.description: Briefly state the order you want the court to make. Do not state the reasons for this order here.

elements.name: ARQ8J
elements.title: Please explain why you are asking for this order [Other]
elements.description: Provide the facts that support your claim for this order.

elements.name: ARComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: ClaimQ1
elements.title: You are suing as
elements.description: The person/entity that is bringing a claim should be the one directly involved in the dispute. For example they have suffered damages, is owed a debt or is party to a contract dispute.

elements.name: ClaimQ2
elements.title: Are you 19 years of age or older?

elements.name: ClaimQ3
elements.title: Do you have a litigation guardian to act on your behalf?
elements.description: If you are under 19 years of age, you must start the claim through an adult who lives in BC and is willing to act as your litigation guardian. This person must file at the registry a signed consent to act as litigation guardian and certificate of fitness.

elements.name: ClaimQ4
elements.title: What is the name of your litigation guardian?

elements.name: ClaimQ3Error
elements.title: You must have a litigation guardian to act on your behalf. If you are unable to get one contact the child and youth services section of the Public Guardian and Trustee. You may contact their office by phone at 604-660-4444 or 1-800-663-7867 or by email at mail@trustee.bc.ca

elements.name: ClaimQ3Note2
elements.title: What if I can't find an adult to act as my litigation guardian?
elements.body: Contact the child and youth services section of the public Guardian and Trustee. You may contact their office by phone at 604-660-4444 or 1-8000-663-7867 or by email at mail@trustee.bc.ca

elements.name: Q3Definition
elements.title: A litigation guardian is an adult who lives in BC and is willing to act on your behalf in legal matters. This person must file at the registry a signed consent to act as litigation guardian and certificate of fitness.

elements.name: Claimant1
elements.title: What is your full name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: ClaimQ7
elements.title: Has a lawyer agreed to receive documents on your behalf?
elements.description: If you have retained a lawyer to be the lawyer on record they will usually receive documents for you. If you are unsure it is best to clarify with them.

elements.name: [CLAddress]
elements.title: What is the lawyer's address where they can receive documents?
elements.description: This will usually be the address of their firm.

elements.name: [CLContact]
elements.title: Lawyer's Contact Info

elements.name: ClaimantComp
elements.title: What is the registered name of the company making the claim?

elements.name: ClaimantCompQ1
elements.title: How do I find out the registered name?

elements.name: CAddress
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: CContact
elements.title: Contact Info

elements.name: COccupation
elements.title: What is your occupation?
elements.description: For example, web designer, accountant, nurse, student, waiter, etc.

elements.name: NDQ1
elements.title: Do you wish to sue a single person or entity?
elements.description: If you are unsure who to name as a defendant you should seek legal advice.

elements.name: NDQ1Define1
elements.title: Entities include companies, businesses, partnerships, societies, agencies and governments.

elements.name: NDQ1End
elements.title: I'm afraid at this time this tool is only available for single party defendant lawsuits. If you wish to name multiple defendants you will need to fill out the court forms here:

elements.name: NDQ2
elements.title: You are suing
elements.description: The person or entity you are suing is called the defendant.

elements.name: NDQ2Q1
elements.title: How do I know if it's an incorporated company?
elements.body: Usually the name of an incorporated company ends with Limited (Ltd.), Corporation (Corp.) or Incorporated (Inc.)

elements.name: NDQ2Continue
elements.title: Proceed to the next page.

elements.name: NDQ3
elements.title: What is the full name of the person you are suing?
elements.description: Do not include titles such as Mr., Ms. or Dr.

elements.name: NDQ3Q1
elements.title: They have two names, I'm not sure which one to use.
elements.body: If they have two names you can write "also known as". For example Tina Jones also known as Tina Williams.

elements.name: NDQ4
elements.title: What is the name of the business you are suing?

elements.name: NDQ4Q1
elements.title: How do I find out the correct name of the business?
elements.body: Contact your local business licence office at city hall and ask for the correct name of the business and the name of the owner. You will want to name both the business and the owner so that if you get a judgment you can collect from either of them. For example, Sam Kiss, carrying on business as Sam's Cake Shop.

elements.name: NDQ5
elements.title: What is the registered name of the incorporated company you are suing?

elements.name: NDQ5Q1
elements.title: How do I find out the registered name?
elements.body: To get the correct name and address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for Requesting Searches & Certificates” (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/business/managing-a-business/permits-licences/businesses-incorporated-companies/searches-certificates)

elements.name: NDQ6
elements.title: What is the name of the partnership you are suing?

elements.name: NDQ6Q1
elements.title: How do I name the partnership?
elements.body: You will want to name the partners and the partnership. For example Kiko Yi and Anna Smith, carrying on business as Westcoast Delivery.

elements.name: NDQ7
elements.title: What is the name of the society you are suing?

elements.name: NDQ7Q1
elements.title: [BLANK]
elements.body: You must obtain a printout of a search showing the delivery address and mailing address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies. The search is done through the Corporate Registry.

elements.name: NDQ8
elements.title: Please name the entity you are suing.

elements.name: NDQ9
elements.title: What is [Defendant 1]'s address?
elements.description: The address will be where they will receive all their court documents.

elements.name: NDQ9Q1
elements.title: What if I don't know their address?

elements.name: NDQ9Q2
elements.title: For an incorporated company what address do I use?
elements.body: If the company is incorporated you must provide the registered office as the address. In some cases this may be a different address than where business is carried out.

elements.name: NDQ9Q3
elements.title: How do I find out the registered office address?
elements.body: To get the correct name and address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for Requesting Searches & Certificates” (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/business/managing-a-business/permits-licences/businesses-incorporated-companies/searches-certificates)

elements.name: NDQ10
elements.title: What is [Defendant1]'s contact information?

elements.name: NDQ12
elements.title: What is [Defendant 1]'s occupation?
elements.description: If you don't know their occupation, simply write "unknown".

elements.name: NDQ12Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: ContractQ1
elements.title: Did you have a contract or agreement with the defendant?
elements.description: Agreement can be a verbal agreement. For example the plumber agreed to fix my kitchen pipes for $200.

elements.name: ContractQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: ContractQ2
elements.title: Is your contract/agreement in writing?

elements.name: ContractQ3
elements.title: Did you sign your contract?

elements.name: ContractQ4
elements.title: What date did you sign your contract?
elements.description: If you're not sure of the exact date, give the approximate date as best you can.

elements.name: ContractQ5
elements.title: When did you make this contract/agreement?
elements.description: If you're not sure of the exact date, give the approximate date as best you can.

elements.name: ContractQ6
elements.title: Where did you make the contract/agreement?

elements.name: ContractQ7
elements.title: Briefly describe the nature of the contract/agreement
elements.description: For example: The defendant agreed to hire the claimant as a project manager for the XYZ project for a period of 6 months starting October 2018.

elements.name: ContractQ8
elements.title: Which situation best describes your dispute:

choices.text: You and [Defendant1] disagree about the term(s) in the contract
You and the defendant disagree about the validity of the contract
The defendant has in your view not fulfilled their obligations under the contract

elements.name: ContractQ9
elements.title: Describe the disagreement over the term in the contract

elements.name: ContractQ10
elements.title: Describe your disagreement

elements.name: ContractQ11
elements.title: Describe the obligation under the contract that the defendant has not fulfilled and how it has not been fulfilled

elements.name: ContractQ14
elements.title: Please describe the issue

elements.name: ContractQ12
elements.title: Have you requested that [defendant] fulfill their obligation?

elements.name: ContractQ13
elements.title: When did you make this request?

elements.name: ContractQ15
elements.title: Have you incurred any damages because of the contract dispute?

elements.name: ContractQ15Define1
elements.title: Damages or costs are the impact you have suffered as a result of the defendant's wrong doing.  For example if someone injured you your damages might include medical bills or lost income.

elements.name: ContractQ16
elements.title: Please describe these damages
elements.description: For example, because of the contract, I turned down another employment opportunity and thereby financially suffered.

elements.name: ContractQ19
elements.title: Please list the costs you are wanting to claim from [Defendant] describe and amount

elements.name: ContractQ20
elements.title: Do you want to claim any other remedies from [defendant]?

elements.name: ContractQ17
elements.title: Please list any other remedies you are claiming from the defendant

elements.name: ContractQ18
elements.title: Describe any other relevant facts about the contract dispute you want the court to know about

elements.name: ContractComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: DebtsQ1
elements.title: Is money owed to you by [Defendant1]?

elements.name: DebtsQ1End
elements.title: Go back to the previous page and select another category.

elements.name: DebtsQ2
elements.title: [Defendant1] owes you money for:

elements.name: DebtsQ2DefineServices
elements.title: Services would include work done by one person for another. For example, being hired to paint someone's house or to give them swimming lessons.

elements.name: DebtsQ2DefineGoods
elements.title: Goods would include items such as a car, a TV or furniture. Animals are considered goods.

elements.name: DebtsQ3
elements.title: Were the services you provided at the request of [defendant1]?

elements.name: DebtsQ4
elements.title: Briefly describe the service you provided:
elements.description: For example, I was hired by the defendant to reroof their home. I rendered these services but have not been paid fully for them.

elements.name: DebtsQ5
elements.title: When did you provide the service?

elements.name: DebtsQ6
elements.title: Where did you provide the service?

elements.name: DebtsQ5Help1
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around". For example, "around 29th avenue and main street."

elements.name: DebtsQ15
elements.title: Did you agree on the price for the service?

elements.name: DebtsQ16
elements.title: What price?

elements.name: DebtsQ7
elements.title: How much did you loan to [Defendant1]?
elements.description: Describe the amount that was to be paid, when and how it was to be paid. Include any other relavent details about the agreed upon payment.

elements.name: DebtsQ8
elements.title: When did you give [Defedant1] this loan?

elements.name: DebtsQ7Help
elements.title: What if we didn't agree on a price?
elements.body: If no set price was decided on describe how the service or goods was to be paid. For example, you provided an estimate price of $6000 for the repairs but agreed that the final price would be determined once work was completed. You did a final price assessment on October 25, 2017 and sent a the final invoice for $7000 to the Defendant.

elements.name: DebtsQ10
elements.title: Where did you give the defendant the loan?

elements.name: DebtsQ10Help
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around".

elements.name: DebtsQ32
elements.title: Did you agree on a date the loan was to be repaid?

elements.name: DebtsQ11
elements.title: When was the loan to be repaid?

elements.name: DebtsQ12
elements.title: Was there an agreed upon interest rate on the loan?

elements.name: DebtsQ13
elements.title: Please provide the details of the interest rate

elements.name: DebtsQ14
elements.title: Describe any other relevant terms of the loan

elements.name: DebtsQ33
elements.title: Did [defendant1] fail to meet the terms of the loan?

elements.name: DebtsQ22
elements.title: Explain

elements.name: DebtsQ17
elements.title: Briefly describe the goods you sold to [Defendant1]:
elements.description: For example, I sold to the Defendant a 2015 Toyota Yaris.

elements.name: DebtsQ18
elements.title: When did you provide these goods?

elements.name: DebtsQ19
elements.title: Where did you provide these goods?

elements.name: DebtsQ19Help
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around".

elements.name: DebtsQ20
elements.title: Did you agree on a price for the goods?

elements.name: DebtQ21
elements.title: What price?
elements.description: Describe the amount that was to be paid, when and how it was to be paid. Include any other relevant details about the agreed upon payment. For example the defendant agreed to pay $6000 in two instalments, to be paid October 1st 2018 and October 15th 2018.

elements.name: DebtsPanelQ23
DebtsQ23
elements.title: Did [Defendant1] partially pay you?

elements.name: DebtsQ24
elements.title: How much did [Defendant1] partially pay you
elements.description: Describe the amount that was paid and any other relevant details about the payment.

elements.name: DebtsQ24Help
elements.title: What if we didn't agree on a price
elements.body: If no set price was decided on describe how the service or goods was to be paid. For example, you provided an estimate price of $6000 for the repairs but agreed that the final price would be determined once work was completed. You did a final price assessment on October 25, 2017 and sent a the final invoice for $7000 to the Defendant.

elements.name: DebtsQ25
elements.title: When did [Defendant1] make this payment to you?

elements.name: DebtsQ26
elements.title: How much does [Defendant1] still owe you?

elements.name: DebtsQ27
elements.title: Have you made demands of [Defendant1] to repay you?

elements.name: DebtsQ28
elements.title: Do you wish to claim the amount still owed from [Defendant1]?

elements.name: DebtsQ29
elements.title: Is there any other amount or remedy you are claiming from [Defendant1]?

elements.name: DebtsQ29End
elements.title: END

elements.name: DebtsQ30
elements.title: Please list all other amounts and remedies you are claiming. Describe what the claim is and the amount.
elements.description: If you are looking for a remedy that has no dollar value you may leave the amount space blank.

elements.name: DebtsQ31
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: DebtsProceed1
elements.title: Complete

elements.visibleIf: ({DebtsQ15} notempty and {DebtsQ2} = "DebtsQ2Service") or ({DebtsQ33} notempty and {DebtsQ2} = "DebtsQ2Loan") or ({DebtsQ20} notempty and {DebtsQ2} = "DebtsQ2Goods")

elements.name: GeneralQ1
elements.title: Please describe what happened

elements.name: GeneralQ2
elements.title: Where did it happen?

elements.name: GeneralQ3
elements.title: When did it happen?

elements.name: GeneralQ4
elements.title: Please list all amounts and remedies you are claiming from [defendant]. Describe nature and the amount.

elements.name: GeneralComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: MVAQ1
elements.title: Were you involved in a car accident?

elements.name: MVAQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: MVAQ2
elements.title: You were...

choices.text: driving a car involved in the accident
a passanger of a car involved in the accident
a cyclist involved in the accident
a pedestrian involved in the accident

elements.name: MVAQ3
elements.title: Where did the accident take place?
elements.description: Please provide the direction you were travel (e.g. north bound) and if it was at an intersection (e.g. at the intersection of main street and 5th avenue). If you are unsure of the exact location describe the location as "at or around" or "near". For example at or around 222 Nelson road. Or alternatively east bound on highway 1 near exit 55.

elements.name: MVAQ4
elements.title: When did the accident occur?

elements.name: MVAQ4Q1
elements.title: What if I don't know the time?
elements.body: If you are unable to give an approximate time of day when the accident occurred provide details you may know such as morning, afternoon, evening, night after or before a certain time.

elements.name: MVAQ5
elements.title: [Defendant1] is...

choices.text: the driver of the other car
the driver of the car you were in
a cyclist involved in the accident

elements.name: MVAQ6
elements.title: Please briefly describe the accident

elements.name: MVAQ6N1
elements.title: Provide information on what direction the people involved in the accident were traveling and how the accident occurred. For example: the claimant was travelling south in the inside lane on Main Street. When the plaintiff approached the intersection of Main Street and 15th Avenue, the defendant, proceeding east on 15th Avenue, made a left-hand turn onto Main Street, without signal or warning to the plaintiff, in front of the plaintiff’s motor vehicle.

elements.name: MVAQ7
elements.title: Was the collision caused or contributed to by the negligence of [Defendant1]?

elements.name: MVAQ8
elements.title: Pick all that apply: The collision caused you ...

choices.text: pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life
future loss of income and future earning capacity
loss of income and loss of opportunity to earn income

elements.name: MVAQ9
elements.title: Describe [Pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life]

elements.name: MVAQ10
elements.title: Describe [Future loss of income and future earning capacity]

elements.name: MVAQ11
elements.title: Describe [Loss of income and loss of opportunity to earn income]

elements.name: MVAQ12
elements.title: Describe [Your future cost of care]

elements.name: MVAQ13
elements.title: Describe [Loss of house maintenance capacity]

elements.name: MVAQ14
elements.title: Describe [Out of pocket expenses]

elements.name: MVAQ15
elements.title: Describe [Any other quantifiable loss]

elements.name: MVAQ9A
elements.title: Do you wish to make a claim against [defendant] for this?

elements.name: MVAQ9B
elements.title: How much are you claiming?

elements.name: MVAQ16
elements.title: Have you incurred any other costs or damages that you wish to claim against [defendant1]?

elements.name: MVAQ17
elements.title: List your costs/damages:

elements.name: MVAQ18
elements.title: Are you seeking any other remedy from [defendant]?

elements.name: MVAQ19
elements.title: What remedy are you looking for?

elements.name: MVAQ20
elements.title: Are there any other relevant facts you want the court to know?

elements.name: MVAQ21
elements.title: Please describe any other relevant facts related to this case you wish the court to know.
elements.description: Only include facts that are related to your case that you have not yet included.

elements.name: MVAComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: PIQ1
elements.title: Did you suffer injuries because of [defendant]'s actions or negligence?
elements.description: This could include actions that are intentional (such as hitting someone) or not intentional (such as carelessly throwing a baseball into a crowd). It could also include the failure to do an action such as clean up the slip on the store floor where people are walking.

elements.name: PIQ1End
elements.title: Go back to the previous page and select another category.

elements.name: PIQ2
elements.title: On what date did the injury occur?

elements.name: PIQ3
elements.title: Where did the injury occur?

choices.text: at [defendant]'s place of work or business

elements.name: PIQ3a
elements.title: What is the exact address of the location?

elements.name: PIQ4
elements.title: Describe how the injury occurred:
elements.description: Give a short and accurate account of what happened. For example, you were walking through the store, owned by the defendant, when you slipped and fell onto your back. The fall was due to a liquid spill in the middle of the shopping aisle. There was no sign or warning to indicate there was a spill. You did not see the liquid before you fell. Due to the fall you suffered injury.

elements.name: PIQ5
elements.title: Injuries caused you...
elements.description: Pick all that apply.

choices.text: pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life
past lost income and loss of opportunity to earn income
future loss of income and future earning capacity

elements.name: PIQ5Q1
elements.title: I'm unsure what injuries to pick.
elements.body: If you are unsure about the extent of your damages it is best if you speak to a lawyer and get legal advice. In general you may be able to claim compensation if for example the injury caused you to loss wages, incur medical expenses and caused you pain and suffering.

elements.name: PIQ5DefinePocket
elements.title: Out of pocket expenses could cover any expense you had due to the injury such as medical treatment, or medications.

elements.name: PIPanelA
PIQ6A
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7A
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7ADefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8A
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life

elements.name: PIPanelB
PIQ6B
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7B
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7BDefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8B
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Past lost income and loss of opportunity to earn income

elements.name: PIPanelC
PIQ6C
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7C
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7CDefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8C
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Future loss of income and future earning capacity

elements.name: PIPanelD
PIQ6D
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7D
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7DDefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8D
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Future cost of care

elements.name: PIPanelE
PIQ6E
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7E
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7EDefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8E
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Loss of house maintenance capacity

elements.name: PIPanelF
PIQ6F
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: PIQ7F
elements.title: Do you wish to claim damages for this?

elements.name: PIQ7FDefine
elements.title: Damages is money that is to be paid for losses caused by the injury.

elements.name: PIQ8F
elements.title: How much are you claiming for this from [defendant]?
Out of pocket expenses

elements.name: PIQ9
elements.title: Are there any other remedies you are wishing to claim against [defendant]?

elements.name: PIQ10
elements.title: Please list any other remedies and amount you are claiming from [defendant]
elements.description: If you are looking for a remedy that has no dollar value you may leave the amount space blank.

elements.name: PIQ11
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: PIQ11Q1
elements.title: Tips on how to write in a court form
elements.body: see (link to external content google sheet legal writing tips)

elements.name: PIEnd
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: GoodQ0
elements.title: You are unsatisfied with goods you bought from [defendant]

elements.name: GoodQ0End
elements.title: END

elements.name: GoodQ1
elements.title: Describe the goods you bought from [Defendant1]
elements.description: For example: an 2008 Toyota Yaris, or antique dining room table set, that included 6 chairs.

elements.name: GoodQ2
elements.title: When did you buy the goods from [Defendant1]?
elements.description: If you can't remember the exact date or it occurred on a range of dates give your best estimation.

elements.name: GoodPanelQ3
GoodQ3Store
elements.title: Store Name

elements.name: GoodQ3Address
elements.title: Address

elements.name: GoodQ3Help
elements.title: What if I bought them online?
elements.body: If you bought them online, write the address you were to pick good up at or they were to be delivered to.

elements.title: Where did you buy the goods from [Defendant1]?
elements.description: If you bought goods in a store provide the name and address of that store.

elements.name: GoodQ4
elements.title: What was wrong with the goods?

choices.text: The goods did not meet the description or sample provided by the Defendant.
The goods were not reasonably fit for the purpose they were to have.
The goods did not last for a reasonable time.

elements.name: GoodQ4DefineFit
elements.title: Reasonably fit: In a good enough/working condition as you would expect them to be in. For example a 20 year old car may need new parts but you expect in running condition if it was advertised as a working car.

elements.name: GoodQ4DefineTime
elements.title: Reasonable time: The amount of time a person would expect this specific good to last, considering it's age and condition.

elements.name: GoodQ8
elements.title: When did you discover the good did not meet the description or sample?

elements.name: GoodQ13
elements.title: Please explain

elements.name: GoodQ9
elements.title: When did you discover the goods were not reasonably fit for the purpose they were to have?

elements.name: GoodQ14
elements.title: Please explain

elements.name: GoodQ10
elements.title: When did you discover the goods did not last for a reasonable time?

elements.name: GoodQ15
elements.title: Please explain

elements.name: GoodQ12
elements.title: OTHER: When did you discover this?

elements.name: GoodQ17
elements.title: OTHER: Please explain

elements.name: GoodQ5
elements.title: Did the Defendant agree to deliver or make available the goods to you on a specific day?

elements.name: GoodQ6
elements.title: When were the goods to be delivered?

elements.name: GoodQ7
elements.title: Provide any relevant details on what happened

elements.name: GoodPanelQ18
GoodQ18
elements.title: Did you pay for the goods?

elements.name: GoodQ19
elements.title: How much did you pay [Defendant1]

elements.name: GoodQ20
elements.title: When did you pay [Defendant1]?

elements.visibleIf: ({GoodQ4} notempty and {GoodQ4} notcontains "GoodQ4E") or ({GoodQ4} notempty and {GoodQ5} notempty)

elements.name: GoodQ23
elements.title: Have you incurred any costs or damages that you wish to claim against [defendant1]?

elements.name: GoodQ24
elements.title: List your costs/damages

elements.name: GoodQ25
elements.title: Are you seeking any other remedy from [defendant1]?

elements.name: GoodQ26
elements.title: What remedy are you looking for?

elements.name: GoodQ21
elements.title: Are there any other relevant facts you want the court to know?

elements.name: GoodQ22
elements.title: Describe

elements.name: GoodComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: ServiceQ1
elements.title: Describe service [Defendant] agreed to provide
elements.description: For example, the defendant was hired by the claimant to reroof their home.

elements.name: ServiceQ1Q1
elements.title: Do I need to have a written agreement?
elements.body: No, the agreement could be oral. An agreement is usually binding one there is an exchange of promises. For example, Anne promise to pay the hairdresser a set amount and they promise to cut her hair, or Bob will pay the consultant $6,000 for their services consulting on a business opportunity.

elements.name: ServiceQ2
elements.title: When did you make an agreement for the service?

elements.name: ServiceQ3
elements.title: Where did you make an agreement for the service?

elements.name: ServiceQ4
elements.title: Did you agree upon a price for the service?

elements.name: ServiceQ5
elements.title: How much was that price?

elements.name: ServiceQ6
elements.title: Did you pay this full price to [defendant]?

elements.name: ServiceQ9a
elements.title: When did you pay this?

elements.name: ServiceQ7
elements.title: Did you partially pay [defendant]?

elements.name: ServiceQ9
elements.title: How much did you pay?

elements.name: ServiceQ11
elements.title: When did you pay [defendant]?

elements.name: ServiceQ10
elements.title: How much remains to pay [Defendant]?

elements.name: ServiceQ8
elements.title: Did you pay [Defendant1]?

elements.name: ServiceQ8a
elements.title: How much did you pay?

elements.name: ServiceQ8b
elements.title: When did you pay this?

elements.name: ServicePanelQ12
ServiceQ12
elements.title: Chose which you think best describes your situation:

choices.text: The service was not according to your agreement
The service was not of quality
The defendant in performing service caused me or my property damage

elements.name: ServiceQ13A
elements.title: Please give more detail for "Service not completed"

elements.name: ServiceQ13B
elements.title: Please give more detail for "Not according to your agreement"

elements.name: ServiceQ13C
elements.title: Please give more detail for "Not of quality"

elements.name: ServiceQ13D
elements.title: Please give more detail for "Resulted in damages"

elements.name: ServiceQ13E
elements.title: Please give more detail for "Other"

elements.name: ServiceQ14
elements.title: Have you incurred costs or damages that you want to claim from the [defendant]?

elements.name: ServiceQ15
elements.title: Please list the costs you are wanting to claim from [Defendant1] (description and amount)
elements.description: List each cost separately as a new entry.

elements.name: ServiceQ16
elements.title: Do you want to claim any other remedies from [Defendant1]?

elements.name: ServiceQ17
elements.title: Please list any other remedies you are claiming from [Defendant1]
elements.description: List each cost separately as a new entry.

elements.name: ServiceQ18
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: ServiceComplete

elements.visibleIf: ({ServiceQ4} = "n" and {ServiceQ8} notempty) or ({ServiceQ4} = "y" and {ServiceQ6} = "y") or ({ServiceQ4} = "y" and {ServiceQ6} = "n" and {ServiceQ7} notempty)

elements.name: CSQ0
elements.title: You are filling out this form because you wish to prove to the courts you served a specific document

elements.name: CSQ0Define
elements.title: To serve documents means giving/ delivering a document to someone.  There are specific rules on how to give certain court forms to other parties in a lawsuit.

elements.name: CSQ0End
elements.title: SORRY you cannot proceed with this court form. Please review your answers and seek legal advice if you are unsure how to proceed.

elements.name: CSQ1
elements.title: Who are you?
elements.description: You are the claimant if you are the one who start the lawsuit. You are the defendant if you are named as a defendant in the Notice of Claim.

elements.name: CSQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: CSQ2Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ3
elements.title: Who did you serve?
elements.description: Who is it you gave the document to.

elements.name: CSQ3Define1
elements.title: To serve documents means giving/ delivering a document to someone.  There are specific rules on how to give certain court forms to other parties in a lawsuit.

elements.name: CSQ3Q1
elements.title: Where can I learn more about serving court forms?
elements.body: For guidance on how to serve documents in a Small Claims Court  lawsuit see the Serving Documents How to Guide (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/justice/courthouse-services/small-claims/how-to-guides/serving-documents)

elements.name: CSQ4
elements.title: What is the name of the person you served?

elements.name: CSQ5
elements.title: When did you serve [PersonServed]?

elements.name: CSQ6
elements.title: Where did you serve [personServed]?

elements.name: CSQ6Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ13
elements.title: Who is [PersonServed]?

elements.name: CSQ13Define1
elements.title: Individual includes a sole proprietorship if you are suing the owner. For example the defendant is Anna Smithe Carrying on Business as Smithe Plumbing.

elements.name: CSQ13Define2
elements.title: Municipality is a local government incorporated by the province. E.g. a city or a town.

elements.name: CSQ13Define3
elements.title: Registered Mail is a service offered by Canada Post to customers who require proof of mailing and/or proof of delivery.

elements.name: CSQ15
elements.title: Is [PersonServed] under the age of 19?

elements.name: CSQ16
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Leave a copy of the notice with the parents/guardians of [personserved]?

elements.name: CSQ16Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ16Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ17
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy by ordinary mail to them
Mail a copy by registered mail to them
Leave a copy with them personally?

elements.name: CSQ17Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ17Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ14
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy by registered mail to them
Mail a copy by ordinary mail to them
Leave a copy of the notice with them?

elements.name: CSQ14Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ14Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ19
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Leave a copy with the receptionist?
Leave a copy at the place of business?
Leave a copy with a partner?
Mail a copy by ordinary mail to them
Mail a copy by registered mail to them

elements.name: CSQ19Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ19Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ18
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy by ordinary mail to them
Mail a copy by registered mail to them
Leave a copy of the notice with them?

elements.name: CSQ18Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ18Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ22
elements.title: Is the company incorporated in BC?
elements.description: Before you filed your Notice of Claim you should have done a corporation search to determine if the company is incorporated in BC or not.

elements.name: CSQ23
elements.title: Is the company registered as an extraprovincial company under the business corporation act?

elements.name: CSQ27
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy of it by registered mail to the attorney shown in the corporate registry
Leave a copy of it with the attorney shown in the corporate registry
Leave a copy of it at the head office shown in the corporate registry if that head office is in BC
Mail a copy by registered mail to the head office shown in the corporate registry if that head office is in BC
Mail a copy by ordinary mail

elements.name: CSQ27Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ27Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ25
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy of it by registered mail to the registered office of the company
Leave a copy at registered office of company
Leave a copy of it at the place of business of the company, with a receptionist or person who appears to manage or control the business
Leave a copy of it with a director, officer, liquidator, trustee in bankruptcy or receiver manager of the company
Mail a copy by ordinary mail

elements.name: CSQ25Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ25Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ24
elements.title: Is the company incorporated outside of BC?

elements.name: CSQ24Q1
elements.title: How do I know if they are incorporated in BC?
elements.body: To get the correct address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for “Requesting Searches & Certificates”.

elements.name: CSQ24End
elements.title: SORRY you cannot proceed with this court form. Please review your answers and seek legal advice if you are unsure how to proceed.

elements.name: CSQ26
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Mail a copy of it by registered mail to a place of business or registered office of the corporation outside BC
Leave a copy of it at a place of business or registered office of the corporaction outside BC with a receptionist or a person who appears to manage or control the business
Leave a copy of it with a director, officer, liquidator, trustee in bankruptcy or receiver manager of the corporation

elements.name: CSQ26Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ26Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ20
elements.title: Did you...

choices.text: Give a copy to clerk, deputy clerk, or similar official?

elements.name: CSQ20Other
elements.title: Please explain... (other service or instructions given...)
elements.description: If you have been given directions or an order by the court to allow for a way to serve documents

elements.name: CSQ20Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ21
elements.title: How did you serve the document?

elements.name: CSQ21Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: CSQ29
elements.title: Please select all the documents that you served

elements.name: CSQ31
elements.title: What is the name of the document you served?
elements.description: If it was a court form please provide the name of the court form.

elements.name: CSQ30
elements.title: You will need to attach a copy of the documents you served to this Certificate of Service form before you file it with the courts. Do you agree to do so?

elements.name: CSQ30End
elements.title: SORRY you cannot proceed with this court form. Please review your answers and seek legal advice if you are unsure how to proceed.

elements.name: CSQ30Complete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: RYQ0Note1
elements.title: If you have received a Small Claims Court Notice of Claim, you are being sued. In most cases, you have 14 days to file your reply with the court. This guided pathway will help you fill out your Reply form. It is however up to you to file it at the court registry.

elements.name: RYQ1
elements.title: Are you [Defendant]?

elements.name: RYQ3
elements.title: Are you replying to a notice of claim?

elements.name: RYQ3End
elements.title: Sorry in order to fill out the reply form you need to be a party (either named as the defendant or claimant) to this case.

elements.name: RYQ5
elements.title: Is this your address? [Defendant's Address]

elements.name: RYQ6
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: RYQ6Help1
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: RYQ6Help2
elements.title: What address do I give for a company or society?
elements.body: If the company is incorporated you must provide the registered office as the address. In some cases this may be a different address than where business is carried out. For a society use the address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies.

elements.name: RYQ5Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: RYQ2
elements.title: Are you [Claimant]?

elements.name: RYQ2End
elements.title: Sorry, in order to fill out the reply form you need to be a party (either named as the defendant or claimant) to this case.

elements.name: RYQ4
elements.title: Are you replying to a counterclaim?

elements.name: RYQ4End
elements.title: Sorry in order to fill out the reply form you need to be a party (either named as the defendant or claimant) to this case.

elements.name: RYQ7
elements.title: Is this your address? [Claimant's Address]

elements.name: RYQ8
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: RYQ8Q1
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: RYQ8Q2
elements.title: What address do I give for a company or society?
elements.body: If the company is incorporated you must provide the registered office as the address. In some cases this may be a different address than where business is carried out. For a society use the address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies.

elements.name: RYQ7Continue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: RYPanelQ10
RYQ11
elements.title: Briefly describe why you disagree:

elements.name: RYQ11Help
elements.title: What if I think someone else should pay?
elements.body: If you think there is someone other than you who should pay all or a portion of the claim, you can make a third party claim. You will need to file a third party notice form which can be found online at __________.

elements.title: The following are claims made by the other side. Please indicate how you wish to respond:

elements.name: RYQ12
elements.title: Do you agree to pay part or all of the amount claimed by the other party?

elements.name: RYQ13
elements.title: How much do you agree to pay?

elements.name: RYQ14
elements.title: Provide detail about the payment you are willing to pay.
elements.description: Helpful details to include: If you can pay all at once or need to pay over a period of time, amount and frequency of payments, a delayed start date for payments etc.

elements.name: RYQ14Help
elements.title: What if I want to pay but can't pay it all right now?
elements.body: If you want to pay the claim but you need some time - and you can't come to an agreement with the claimant - fill in this space with the sort of payment arrangements you want to make.

elements.name: RYQ15
elements.title: Do you wish to make a counterclaim against the [claimant]?
elements.description: You can only make a counterclaim if you are replying to a Notice of Claim.

elements.name: RYQ15Help1
elements.title: How much can my counterclaim be?
elements.body: Defendants in Small Claims Court can counterclaim up to $35,000 – if it is more, this is a matter for the Supreme Court.

elements.name: RYQ15End
elements.title: END

elements.name: RYQ16
elements.title: Briefly explain your counterclaim.
elements.description: What happened that led to you having a claim against the claimant. For example if they are suing you for unfinished plumbing you were to provide your counterclaim may be that you stopped work because they failed to follow the payment schedule. The amount of $6000 was due for work already done on September 15th 2018 but they never paid.

elements.name: RYQ17
elements.title: Please list all the amounts you are wanting to claim from [Defendant]. Describe the nature of the claim and the amount
elements.description: List each item separately For example: Cost of materials for roofing   $2000 /  Cost of labour    $5000

elements.name: RYQ18
elements.title: Are there any other remedies you are wishing to claim against [Claimant]?

elements.name: RYQ19
elements.title: Please describe the remedies you are claiming:
elements.description: Remedies can be for things you want the other party to do or stop doing. For example you wish for them to provide you access to the work site or for them to return your possessions.

elements.name: RYComplete
elements.title: Complete
